subject: Reply asap
body:
Hello Ma'am,

 My first mail to you  was very clear, I will help you secure the release
of your contract sum which has been delayed by the remittance bank. You
have been proposed many ways to retrieve your funds but till now you have
not seen anything, why not give me a chance to explain before you jump to
conclusion.

I want you to know that all central banks of member states are affiliated
to African Development Bank (ADB) as banks in different member states align
with their central banks so our mandate goes a long way to source the root
of your transactions, the amount involved and why your funds have not
reached you till date.

You have to cooperate with us if not we cannot be able to help you. The
first step is to send a questionnaire to you to test and know if you are
really the owner of the fund and to know your last communication with the
paying bank. We can go a long way to call the money back wherever it is
located in the world because we have the mandate of the African Union (AU)
which is an affiliate of the United Nations (UN).

The earlier you believe what I am telling you and start cooperating the
better and easier for both of us. I am in the introductory part of my
assistance to you.

You will give 10% of the total amount to my boss and 5% to me  after the
transfer of the fund to you.

You have to accept these conditions before I will take the bold step to go
and meet him.

All payments will be made by TT wire transfer, there is no other means
available to us in the banking rules.

I will be expecting your urgent reply.

Alain Coulibaly (Office of the CEO. IRTD. ADB).




Dear Mr. Alain Coulibaly,
Thank you for your email and the information provided. I am interested in
this opportunity, however, I would like to understand more about the
process and what exactly is required from my side.

Could you please provide more details on how we can proceed with this?
Also, could you clarify what percentage of the funds are expected to be
given to the CEO and yourself?

I look forward to hearing from you soon.
Best wishes,
Theresa
